item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, October 13, 2024 at 7:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Starship Flight 5: Launch and booster catch [video] (995 points | 597 comments)
2. The Quiet Art of Attention (144 points | 63 comments)
3. Innovations to Make Tibetan Language a First-Class Citizen in the Digital World (27 points | 7 comments)
4. Diffusion for World Modeling (359 points | 170 comments)
5. Restic: Backups Done Right (49 points | 19 comments)
6. A Novel Channel Contention Mechanism for Improving Wi-Fi's Reliability (53 points | 16 comments)
7. Common Lisp implementation of the Forth 2012 Standard (72 points | 26 comments)
8. Lessons learned from profiling an algorithm in Rust (57 points | 7 comments)
9. Node.js, Pipes, and Disappearing Bytes (39 points | 18 comments)
10. ACF Plugin no longer available on WordPress.org (21 points | 5 comments)
11. Large language models reduce public knowledge sharing on online Q&A platforms (255 points | 222 comments)
12. Ward Christensen (of BBS and XMODEM fame) has died (98 points | 17 comments)
13. Why Google Search Is Falling Apart [video] (43 points | 30 comments)
14. DARPA Thinks Walls of Oysters Could Protect Shores Against Hurricanes (55 points | 13 comments)
15. AI Pioneer Thinks AI Is Dumber Than a Cat (11 points | 3 comments)
16. Exploring Typst, a new typesetting system similar to LaTeX (477 points | 189 comments)
17. What, Exactly, Is 'Moderate Drinking'? (6 points | 3 comments)
18. Show HN: I've added undo and redo to IsoCity (7 points | 3 comments)
19. Can logic programming be liberated from predicates and backtracking? [pdf] (158 points | 52 comments)
20. Pepsi’s Soviet Navy (2021) (49 points | 12 comments)
21. When is causal broadcast not enough for causal memory? (11 points | discuss)
22. Eating less can lead to a longer life: study in mice shows why (188 points | 121 comments)
23. Scientists found a way to make sound travel in only one direction (38 points | 6 comments)
24. 1 bug, $50k in bounties, a Zendesk backdoor (1416 points | 384 comments)
25. Just released: oryx now includes a powerful firewall feature (9 points | 2 comments)
26. The Surprising Predictability of Long Runs (2012) [pdf] (34 points | 9 comments)
27. Even a Single Bacterial Cell Can Sense the Seasons Changing (6 points | 2 comments)
28. Columbus was a Sephardic Jew from Western Europe, study finds (4 points | 1 comment)
29. Every bug/quirk of the Windows resource compiler (rc.exe), probably (194 points | 19 comments)
30. Omni SenseVoice: High-Speed Speech Recognition with Words Timestamps (135 points | 24 comments)
